data.title: NI Test Integration Adapter for IBM Rational Quality Manager 2.0 Readme
data.text:
Version 2.0

June 2014

This file contains important information about the NI Test Integration Adapter for IBM Rational Quality Manager, including system requirements, installation instructions, and new features.

Overview

System Requirements

Application Software Support

Installation Instructions

Product Security and Critical Updates

New Features and Changes

Known Issues

Bug Fixes

Accessing the Help

Automating the Installation of NI Products

How to Use NI Software with Microsoft Windows 8.x

NI Software Support for Microsoft Windows Vista, Windows XP, and Windows Server 2003

Legal Information

Overview

The Test Integration Adapter provides a connection between IBM Rational Quality Manager and NI TestStand. The Test Integration Adapter uses Hypertext Transfer Protocol Secure (HTTPS) to communicate with IBM Rational Quality Manager and TestStand to control test systems. To use the Test Integration Adapter, you must install this software on both the test computer where TestStand runs and the server computer where you install IBM Rational Quality Manager.

System Requirements

The Test Integration Adapter has the following system requirements for the test computer.

System Requirements Recommended Required Operating System

—

Windows 8.1 (32-bit and 64-bit)/Windows 7 (32-bit and 64-bit)/XP Service Pack 3 (32-bit) Processor Pentium 4-M or equivalent Pentium III, Celeron 866 Mhz, or equivalent Memory 1 GB 256 MB Hard Disk Space

—

1 GB

Application Software Support

The Test Integration Adapter supports the following application software versions, including service packs.

TestStand 2012 Service Pack 1 or later

IBM Rational Quality Manager 4.0.x or later

Installation Instructions

To install the Test Integration Adapter on the test computer, insert the NI Test Integration Adapter for IBM Rational Quality Manager 2.0 installation media and follow the instructions that appear on the screen.

To install the Test Integration Adapter on the server computer, refer to the installation instructions at ni.com.

Visit ni.com/security to view and subscribe to receive security notifications about National Instruments products. Visit ni.com/critical-updates for information about critical updates from National Instruments.

New Features and Changes

The Test Integration Adapter includes the following new features:

User Interface Enhancements

The Test Integration Adapter includes the following user interface enhancements:

Use the main window to configure mandatory settings to connect to IBM Rational Quality Manager. The main window includes the following enhancements:

The main window contains the following fields: Server, User Name, Password, Project Area, Adapter Name, and Root Resource Folders.

The main window contains the following new menus:

File—Use this menu to save or revert settings in the main window, refresh root resource folders, and exit the Test Integration Adapter.

Tools—Use this menu to open the log file, the task details page in IBM Rational Quality Manager, or the Configuration dialog box.

Help—Use this menu to display context help and the NI Test Integration Adapter for IBM Rational Quality Manager Help.

Use the new Disconnect button to close the connection between the IBM Rational Quality Manager server and TestStand.

The Test Integration Adapter displays the sequence file under execution at the bottom of the main window. The Current Task textbox no longer exists.

The main window no longer contains the following tabs: Login, Adapter, Resources, HTTP, Upload, Log. The functionality of these tabs are in the main window or the Configuration dialog box.

The main window no longer contains the following buttons: Open Log, Task Details, Apply, Revert, and Close. The functionality of these tabs are in the menu bar of the main window.

Adapter Status in the main window replaced System Status.

Use the new Configuration dialog box to configure optional settings to connect to IBM Rational Quality Manager. This dialog box includes the following pages:

Connection—Configures the settings for connecting to the IBM Rational Quality Manager server.

Execution—Configures the settings for executing sequences in TestStand.

Results—Configures the settings for log files and result files.

Advanced—Configures the advanced settings related to configuring an adapter.

Other Enhancements

The Test Integration Adapter includes the following additional enhancements:

You can select multiple root resource folders in the Root Resource Folders table of the main window.

You can ensure network security by specifying the settings in the Authentication section of the Connection page of the Configuration dialog box.

You can use the new Change TestStand Report Configuration option on the Results page of the Configuration dialog box. You can review the TestStand reports in IBM Rational Quality Manager without manually configuring TestStand to submit HTML reports to IBM Rational Quality Manager.

You can navigate to a file in the Root Resource Folder list of the Find Input Parameters Data File dialog box by filtering. After you enter text in the textbox above Root Resource Folder, the dialog box lists only the folders and files whose names contain the text.

Known Issues

You can access the software and documentation known issues list online. Refer to the National Instruments website for an up-to-date list of known issues in the Test Integration Adapter.

Bug Fixes

The following items are the IDs and titles of a subset of issues fixed in the Test Integration Adapter. This is not an exhaustive list of issues fixed in the current version of the Test Integration Adapter. If you have a CAR ID, you can search this list to validate that the issue has been fixed.

ID Fixed Issue 410941 seqedit.exe is the only supported operator interface 414283 Test result folder for result file upload is always expected to be adjacent to the sequence file 417788 The Test Integration Adapter is unable to connect unless the debug logging path is set on the last tab 417790 The 'x' button on the Test Integration Adapter window is grayed out 419243 The Test Integration Adapter does not support client or server authentication 422621 When a test is stopped through RQM, results are not uploaded 442129 Running a sequence file which doesn't have Single Pass or Test UUTs entry point from RQM results in a TestStand error at runtime 444878 Cannot read Root Resource Folder on a mapped network drive

Accessing the Help

Refer to the NI Test Integration Adapter for IBM Rational Quality Manager Help, accessible by selecting Help»Test Integration Adapter Help from the Test Integration Adapter, for information about the Test Integration Adapter.

Automating the Installation of NI Products

You can automate the installation of most NI products using command-line arguments to suppress some or all of the installer user interface and dialog boxes. However, starting with the August 2012 releases (products using NI Installers version 3.1 or later), you may need to perform additional steps before or during a silent installation of NI software.

If the NI product you are installing uses Microsoft .NET 4.0, the .NET installer may run before any NI software installs and may require a reboot before the installation of NI software begins. To avoid a .NET reboot, install .NET 4.0 separately before you install NI software.

For more information about automating the installation of NI products, refer to the following KnowledgeBase articles:

For more information about silent installations of individual NI products, refer to KB 4CJDP38M, Automating the Installation of a Single Installer.

For more information about silent installations of NI products in a suite, such as NI Developer Suite, refer to KB 4GGGDQH0, Automating the Installation of a Suited Installer.

To determine what version of NI Installers your product contains, refer to KB 4CJDR18M, How Can I Determine the Type and Version of My National Instruments Installer?.

How to Use NI Software with Microsoft Windows 8.x

When you install National Instruments software on Microsoft Windows 8.x, you will notice a few additional tiles in the Apps view, including shortcuts to NI application software products such as NI LabVIEW, Measurement & Automation Explorer (NI MAX), and NI Launcher.

Using NI Launcher

NI Launcher helps you find and launch installed NI products. It provides you with a method of finding NI products similar to the Start menu in previous versions of Microsoft Windows. To use NI Launcher, click the NI Launcher tile in the Apps view. NI Launcher launches the desktop and opens a menu containing a list of NI products. Click any NI product to launch it.

Note NI MAX does not appear as a desktop shortcut when installed on Microsoft Windows 8.x. You can launch NI MAX either from the Apps view or from within NI Launcher.

Pinning Frequently Used Applications

For convenience, you can pin your most-used NI applications, such as MAX, to either the Start screen or the Taskbar on the desktop, as necessary:

Current ApplicationIcon LocationPin to Action Windows 8.x DesktopDesktop TaskbarRight-click application and select Pin to Taskbar Windows 8.x Desktop Start screenRight-click application and select Pin to Start Windows 8.x Start screenDesktop TaskbarRight-click application and select Pin to taskbar from the menu bar on the bottom of the screen

Finding All Programs

If you want to find a particular application or related files, such as documentation files, from the Start screen, you can access all installed files from the Apps view. To get to the Apps view, right-click anywhere on the Start screen and select All apps (Windows 8) or click the down arrow on the bottom left of the screen (Windows 8.1).

For more information about NI support for Windows 8.x, visit ni.com/windows8.

NI Test Integration Adapter for IBM Rational Quality Manager Drops Support for Microsoft Windows Vista, Windows XP, and Windows Server 2003 in 2016

National Instruments Test Integration Adapter for IBM Rational Quality Manager will drop support for Microsoft Windows Vista, Windows XP, and Windows Server 2003 as of July 1, 2016. Versions of the Test Integration Adapter that ship after July 1, 2016 will not install or run on Windows Vista, Windows XP, or Windows Server 2003. For detailed information about NI application software product life cycles, visit ni.com/info and enter one of the following Info Codes:

Product Info Code NI LabVIEWlifecycle NI LabWindows™/CVI™cvi_lifecycle NI Measurement Studiomstudiolifecycle NI TestStandtslcp NI DIAdemddlcp NI SignalExpressselcp NI VeriStandnivslifecycle

Notices are located in the <National Instruments>\_Legal Information and <National Instruments> directories.

Review <National Instruments>\_Legal Information.txt for information on including legal information in installers built with NI products.
